About Me

Nice to meet you! My name is Ashley Norwood and I love all things to do with software engineering. I worked in technical support for an internet company for 8 years. While I loved that, in 2020 in decided to take a different direction with life, and I fell in love with software engineering. I started teaching myself some Javascript in my free time, then decided to go all in and take a Sofware Enginerring Immersive course at General Assembly. This is a decision that was life changing and I'm so glad a made the jump! It may sound odd, but I think part of my engineering brain comes from playing viola for over 15 years. Being part of an orchestra is a lot like programming. Every single instrument in an orchestra is important on its own, but is mostly powerful as part of the team. This taught me to be precise, methodical, and to respect all small parts that make up the big, beautiful picture.
